revised_title: Experimental Researches in Electricity: Thirteenth Series
tldr: In this paper, Michael Faraday investigates the differences in luminous phenomena of electric discharges based on the positive or negative states of the bodies involved. He also examines the effects of various gases on the discharge and the nature of electric light. Faraday concludes that electric light is a consequence of the quantity of electricity that flows and converges towards the spot where it finds the easiest passage.
